alert.note: Alert for Jasper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 24 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall Saturday night continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM CDT, River gages showed that the Spring and North Fork Spring rivers have risen into action and minor flood stage. - This includes the following low water crossings... Dry Fork at Pine Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carthage, Oronogo, Sarcoxie, Jasper, Alba, Purcell, Carytown, Neck City, Avilla, La Russell, Reeds, Maple Grove and Dudenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
